messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Dogs that live in groups have learned that people often give food to smaller, cuter dogs, so these dogs are sent to ask for food for all the group. Some dogs have even learned to use the city's metro system to go from one area to another. Scientists are not sure how the dogs know when to get off the train. One idea is that they use their very good sense of smell, and they have learned to know the smells of their favourite places. Another idea is that they have learned to know the names of stations which they hear in announcements. In any case, people who use the metro have now become so used to seeing dogs on the trains that local people mostly do not notice them.
